parameters.name: time-granularity
parameters.description:
Granularity of statistics. Supported values are:
day
month

parameters.name: start-timestamp
parameters.description: Starting timestamp of when the stats search should begin (milliseconds since epoch)

parameters.name: end-timestamp
parameters.description: Ending timestamp of when the stats search should end (milliseconds since epoch). The current time will be used if parameter not set.

parameters.name: update-key
parameters.description: Optionally provide an update key value to return statistics for a specific company update.

parameters.name: time-granularity
parameters.description:
Granularity of statistics. Supported values are:
day
month

parameters.name: start-timestamp
parameters.description: Starting timestamp of when the stats search should begin (milliseconds since epoch)

parameters.name: end-timestamp
parameters.description: Ending timestamp of when the stats search should end (milliseconds since epoch). The current time will be used if parameter not set.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: A collection of fields describing the shared content.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the content being shared.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of the content being shared.

parameters.name: submitted-url
parameters.description: A fully qualified URL for the content being shared.

parameters.name: submitted-image-url
parameters.description:
A fully qualified URL to a thumbnail image to accompany the shared content.

The image should be at least 80 x 150px for best results. 2MB max filesize.

parameters.name:
comment
A
parameters.description:
A comment by the member to associated with the share.

If none of the above content parameters are provided, the comment must contain a URL to the content you want to share.  If the comment contains multiple URLs, only the first one will be analyzed for content to share.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: A collection of visibility information about the share.

parameters.name:
code
One
parameters.description:
One of the following values:
anyone:  Share will be visible to all members.
connections-only:  Share will only be visible to connections of the member performing the share.

This field is required in all sharing calls.

parameters.name: share-target-reach
parameters.description:
A collection of targeting codes and values used to ensure that the shared content reaches a specific audience.

See targeting company shares for additional information about how to structure a targeted share request.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The offset value for paginating update results by.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of updates to return.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: The value of this field should always be:  code

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The "API Key" value generated when you registered your application.

parameters.name:
redirect_uri
The
parameters.description:
The URI your users will be sent back to after authorization.  This value must match one of the defined OAuth 2.0 Redirect URLs in your application configuration .


e.g. https://www.example.com/auth/linkedin

parameters.name:
state
A
parameters.description:
A unique string value of your choice that is hard to guess. Used to prevent CSRF .


e.g. state=DCEeFWf45A53sdfKef424

parameters.name:
scope
A
parameters.description:
A URL-encoded, space delimited list of member permissions your application is requesting on behalf of the user.  If you do not specify a scope in your call, we will fall back to using the default member permissions you defined in your application configuration .


e.g. scope=r_fullprofile%20r_emailaddress%20w_share

See Understanding application permissions and the Best practices guide for additional information about scopes.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: The value of this field should always be:  authorization_code

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The authorization code you received from Step 2.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The same 'redirect_uri' value that you passed in the previous step.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The "API Key" value generated Step 1.

parameters.name:
client_secret
The
parameters.description:
The "Secret Key" value generated in Step 1.

Follow the Best Practices guide for handing your client_secret value.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The url-encoded URL of the page that you wish to share.

parameters.name: mini
parameters.description: A required argument who's value must always be:  true

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The url-encoded title value that you wish you use.

parameters.name: summary
parameters.description: The url-encoded description that you wish you use.

parameters.name:
source
The
parameters.description: The url-encoded source of the content (e.g. your website or application name)

parameters.name: event-type
parameters.description:
Filter the results to only return updates of the specified event type.


Valid values are:
job-posting
new-product
status-update

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The offset value for paginating update results by.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of updates to return.

parameters.description: The value of this field should always be:  authorization_code
